questions.question: When is it permitted to cross a level crossing, without barriers but signaled with lights, if a train just went by?

options.text: After the flashing red lights stop
After the last wagon has passed
When vehicles on the other side of the railway track start moving.

questions.question: At the warning indicator cross, placed on a railway crossing without barriers, drivers shall stop:

options.text: Close to the railroad, but not lesser than 5 m from it
In a place with maximum visibility, without exceeding the indicator cross
Within 5 m of the railway.

questions.question: The signal flashing white, at slow pace, works:

options.text: When the red light signals at the railway level crossing are off
When the light signals of defective traffic lights are off
When the barriers or semi-barriers are being lowered or lifted.

questions.question: How do you proceed when approaching a railway level crossing without barriers, with the red light and sound signals operating?

options.text: Reduce speed and stop if a train is coming
Speed, if you notice that a train is not approaching
Reduce speed and stop, where there is maximum visibility, without passing signs or stop markings.

questions.question: The interdiction of railway level crossings, provided with automatic signaling systems but without barriers, is achieved:

options.text: When the alternative flash-fire red lights are operating and the white flashing light is off.
When the white flashing light operates
Alternating red and white lights operate.

questions.question: What are your obligations at a railway level crossing if the barriers are raised?

options.text: Make sure you are not overtaken by other vehicles trying to drive through the railway crossing
Horn during the day and flash the high beam at night, then drive through the crossing
Reduce speed, make sure there is no train approaching from the left or right, then cross.

questions.question: Where should you stop if you are at a railroad crossing and the barrier is lowered?

options.text: At the two striped panel
In front of the indicator cross
In front of the barrier.

questions.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing and notice that the semi-barrier is being lowered. What do you do?

options.text: Accelerate and drive as quickly as possible over the railway crossing
Stop in front of the semi-barrier
If there is no train approaching, bypass the semi-barrier.

questions.question: What do you do in the present situation?

options.text: Reduce speed and stop where you have maximum visibility
Reduce speed and stop in front of the last additional panel
Reduce speed and make sure you can cross without any danger.

questions.question: You have the obligation to stop the vehicle immediately at the signals of:

options.text: Officers and non-commissioned officers of the Romanian gendarmerie
The police community
Railway officers at level crossings.

questions.question: Drivers at an industrial railroad crossing must:

options.text: Increase attention
Comply with signals of railroad agents
Ensure and stop if you notice a train approaching.

questions.question: The signals of railways officers with red flags, at industrial railroad crossings oblige drivers to:

options.text: Reduce speed, ensure and cross carefully if the train is more than 50 m from the crossing
Stop
Continue driving as these signals are meant for train drivers.

questions.question: On approaching a railway level crossing without barriers you notice a cart crossing in front of you. In this situation are you allowed to overtake?

options.text: Yes, if the cart has not yet reached railway tracks
Yes, because the cart is a slow vehicle
No

questions.question: This indicator warns:

options.text: It is 150 m from the railway crossing
It is 80 m from the railway crossing
It is 50 m from the railway crossing.

questions.question: How will you proceed on approaching a level crossing fitted with semi-barriers, where the automatic audible signals and red lights are in operation?

options.text: Reduce speed and stop in front of the semi-barrier
Bypass the semi-barrier and continue, if there is no train approaching
Increase speed, not to be trapped under the closing semi-barrier.

questions.questionsNumber: 16 At a railway level crossing, if you find a vehicle immobilized on the tracks, how will you proceed?
questions.question: At a railway level crossing, if you find a vehicle immobilized on the tracks, how will you proceed?

options.text: Continue your journey because qualified railway personnel will handle the situation
Stop and call the police about the incident
Help in moving the vehicle off the tracks, or, if not possible, signal its presence.

questions.question: What do you do in this situation?

options.text: Continue driving as the two alternating red lights indicate permission to cross railroad
Stop
Continue driving if the semi-barriers have not yet descended.

questions.question: What do you do when in the proximity of a railway level crossing without barriers and the red indicator lights are alternately switched on and off?

options.text: Reduce speed and stop only if a train is approaching
Stop the vehicle without exceeding indicator
Reduce speed, and, after making sure there is no train approaching, continue moving.

questions.question: When the audio signals and red lights are working at a railway crossing with barriers, you are warned that:

options.text: The closing and opening of the barrier is not working properly
A train is approaching and the barriers will close automatically
You must cross the barrier urgently.

questions.question: The additional panel indicates:

options.text: A railway level crossing with barriers, equipped with automatic signaling devices
A narrow road sector
Right of way for vehicles approaching from the opposite circulation.

questions.question: When approaching an industrial railroad:

options.text: Motor vehicle drivers will show caution
Motorists have no obligation, if there is no railroad officer
Motorists shall respect the significance of the electric traffic light.

questions.question: How do you proceed at a railway level crossing when the barriers are high?

options.text: Reduce speed without exceeding the continuous stop line
Stop the vehicle in the place where visibility is maximum, without exceeding the cross priority indicator.
Reduce vehicle speed and cross carefully, after ensuring from the left and right that there is no train approaching.

questions.question: What obligations do you have in the situation shown in the picture?

options.text: Do not overtake other vehicles
To reduce speed
Stop 50 meters from the railway crossing.

questions.question: At what distance from a railway level crossing are installed the additional warning signs?

options.text: The first at 90 m, second at 60 m and third at 30 m
The first at 200 m, the second at 150m and third at 100 m
The first at 150 m, the second at 100 m and the third at 50 m.

questions.question: How do you proceed on approaching a railway level crossing, equipped with barriers or semibarrier, and the two red lights are flashing alternatively?

options.text: Continue driving if the barriers are not lowered
Stop, because the barriers are down or will be lowered soon
Continue to move without any restrictions, because the lights only signal the presence of a railway level crossing.

questions.question: What obligations do you have when railway officers signal at level crossings?

options.text: No obligation because railway officers direct trains
To comply with the meaning of their signals
To reduce speed, to make sure there is no train moving and continue driving through the crossing.

questions.question: How do you proceed when crossing a single track level crossing without barriers?

options.text: Stop, without exceeding the cross sign, traverse only after you have ensured that there is no danger
Reduce speed, make sure to the left and right, then traverse carefully
Stop, or else, just reduce speed, make sure, then cross the rails and continue on.

questions.question: Nearing a railway level crossing, you notice that the barriers are being lowered. What do you do?

options.text: Accelerate and drive without hesitation over the crossing
Stop in front of the barrier
Carefully bypass from the left, to avoid being hit by the barrier.

questions.question: If your vehicle remains immobilized on the railroad, you have the following obligations:

options.text: To immediately ask passengers to leave the vehicle. When this is not possible, signal the presence of the vehicle by any suitable means
Call the police
Start the vehicle by any means.

questions.question: indicator warns about:

options.text: A railway level crossing
An industrial railway level crossing
A tram depot.

questions.question: At what distances are the three additional panels installed to warn motorists of a railway level crossing?

options.text: 300, 200 and, respectively, 100 m
90, 60 and, respectively, 30 m
150, 100 and, respectively, 50 m.

questions.question: What obligations do you have in the present situation?

options.text: To drive at reduced speeds and cross the railroad, if the barrier or semi-barrier is high
To stop at the sign
To speed, not to be caught under the closing barriers.

questions.question: In this situation, you are warned that:

options.text: You are approaching a railway level crossing equipped with barriers
You are approaching an industrial railroad level crossing
You are approaching a steep shoreline.
